forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 51. West wind around 13 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly sunny, with a high near 60. West wind 13 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
Tonight, Downtown San Francisco rests in a gentle embrace of clouds, as the city prepares for a cool evening. With temperatures dipping to a comfortable low, the west winds whisper through the streets, offering a refreshing interlude to the soft rustle of the evening. The likelihood of rain is minimal, a mere suggestion in the air, which allows for a simple pleasure—a quiet stroll along the waterfront, perhaps, where the faint echoes of the past mingle with the present under the muted glow of streetlights.

As Saturday dawns, expect the sun to break through, offering a mostly sunny spectacle that teases a high of 60 degrees. The cheerful west winds will continue to invigorate the day, playfully tossing leaves and empty wrappers into a delightful dance. Visibility will improve, casting away lingering shadows and revealing the city in its splendid vibrancy. While the marine layer may linger along the edges of the coast, your wardrobe should lean toward comfort; a light jacket will suffice for the breeze, especially as you wander to a local café to enjoy a morning brew or take in the sights at a nearby park. With no grand adventures required, you can savor the ordinary moments—whether it’s a leisurely walk through a neighborhood or simply finding a cozy corner to read.
